item.title: Configuring Ubuntu/Xubuntu and Apache 2 for local development environments
item.description: Most Web server howtos out there are concerned with production environments, where you need a high level of performance and security. As a developer who runs Apache 2 on localhost, you have other requirements, such as quick configuration and flexibility. It’s inconvenient to edit (usually copy & paste) your virtual hosts configuration and add entries to /etc/hosts whenever you are working on new projects (e.g. on GitHub) – especially, if you just want to test something.
